summary: This document is an FBI 302 report summarizing a preparation session with a witness (LV) for trial testimony. It details LV's recollections about Jeffrey Epstein's helicopter purchase through Air Ghislaine Inc., the logistics of passenger transport to Epstein's plane, and other background information. The document includes a copy of a 2007 helicopter inspection and acceptance certificate.

persons.name: Visoski
persons.context: Referred to as 'LV' in the document, he is being prepared for trial testimony. He recalls details about Epstein's helicopter purchase and passenger transport procedures.

persons.name: McGorty
persons.context: Listed as an attorney present during the witness preparation session on November 28, 2021.

persons.name: Zelenko
persons.context: Listed as an attorney present during the witness preparation session on November 28, 2021.

persons.name: Giffuni
persons.context: Listed as an attorney present during the witness preparation session on November 28, 2021.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as JE. The subject of the investigation. LV worked for him starting in 1991 and recalls details about his helicopter purchase and travel habits.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Accompanied Jeffrey Epstein and LV to Connecticut for the helicopter sale in 2007. Also referenced in a related civil case (Doe v. Indyke).

persons.name: Chris Shurkus
persons.context: Was the sales coordinator for Sikorsky Aircraft Corporation during the sale of a helicopter to Jeffrey Epstein's company, Air Ghislaine Inc.

persons.name: Juan Alessi
persons.context: Identified as the houseman at the Palm Beach house who drove Epstein's passengers to the plane at PBI between 1994 and the early 2000s.

persons.name: Janusz
persons.context: Later became the houseman in Palm Beach and also drove passengers to PBI.

persons.name: Igor
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein's security/personal trainer who also drove passengers to PBI.

persons.name: Lance Calloway
persons.context: Named in an attached email regarding the helicopter purchase, alongside Chris Shurkus and Larry Visoski.

connections.description: LV (Visoski) worked for Jeffrey Epstein starting in 1991, handling travel and logistics including a helicopter purchase.
Indyke accompanied Epstein to Connecticut for a helicopter sale in 2007 and is named in a related civil suit.
Alessi was the houseman at Epstein's Palm Beach house and was responsible for driving passengers to the plane.
Shurkus, as a Sikorsky sales coordinator, facilitated the sale of a helicopter to Epstein's company, Air Ghislaine Inc.
LV recalls traveling with both Epstein and Darren Indyke to Connecticut to complete the helicopter sale in 2007.

events.title: Helicopter Purchase and Sale
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein, through his company Air Ghislaine Inc., purchased a Sikorsky S-76C helicopter. The sale was completed in Connecticut with Epstein, Darren Indyke, and LV (Visoski) present.

events.title: Passenger Transport to Plane at PBI
events.description: Between 1994 and 2004, passengers for Jeffrey Epstein's plane would be driven onto the tarmac at Palm Beach International Airport (PBI) by staff including Juan Alessi, Janusz, and Igor.

events.title: Witness Trial Preparation
events.description: Attorneys McGorty, Zelenko, and Giffuni met with witness LV (Visoski) to prepare for trial testimony, discussing logistics and reviewing documents including a 2020 declaration and a 2007 helicopter certificate.

events.title: Helicopter Delivery Acceptance
events.description: Larry Visoski, on behalf of Air Ghislaine Inc., signed a Helicopter Inspection and Acceptance Certificate, formally accepting delivery and title of the Sikorsky helicopter.

keyFacts: A witness (LV/Visoski) recalls that Jeffrey Epstein's company, Air Ghislaine Inc., purchased a Sikorsky helicopter in 2007, with Epstein and his associate Darren Indyke present for the sale in Connecticut.

The witness describes a procedure where Epstein's passengers were driven directly onto the tarmac at Palm Beach International Airport by staff members Juan Alessi, Janusz, and Igor between 1994 and 2004.
The document includes a copy of the official December 31, 2007, Helicopter Inspection and Acceptance Certificate, showing Larry Visoski accepted the helicopter on behalf of Air Ghislaine Inc.
The witness preparation session involved reviewing a 2020 declaration from the civil case 'Doe v. Indyke', indicating a link between that case and the criminal proceedings.
The witness (LV) began working for Jeffrey Epstein in 1991 when Epstein was approximately 37 years old.
